attributes.action: An annual National Sports Day to grow participation in sport & physical activity
attributes.background: One day a year should be designated a National Sports Day (#sportsday). Saturday 27th August 2016 saw the #IAmTeamGB campaign hold free events around the country to encourage people to participate in sport and physical activity. This should become a government supported annual national event.
attributes.additional_details:
In December 2015 Tracey Crouch MP Minister for Sport, Tourism and Heritage launched 'Sporting Future: A New Strategy for an Active Nation', encouraging sport and physical activity as a national priority. Shortly after, Jennie Price Chief Executive, Sport England launched the new 2016-2021 strategy 'Sport England: Towards An Active Nation'.

We need an annual National Sports Day to bring these strategies to life and to capitalise on Team GB & Paralympics GB's potential to inspire the nation.

attributes.action: Ban all HGVs from the third lane of all motorways
attributes.background: Motorway expansion was meant to increase traffic flow but, with lorries using lanes 1 2 and 3, traffic bunches up causing congestion

attributes.action:
make it mandatory to show on ALL products:
- manufacturer
- origin
attributes.background:
Please make it mandatory for all products sold in the UK to display
- manufacturer name
- country of origin
this should apply to products sold under supermarkets' name as well.
for example 
fridge from electronic shop chain named Sandstorm does not show manufacturer and its country of origin!

attributes.action: An NHS research investment donation app for mobile phones and computers.
attributes.background: Well I have ulcerative colitis and every time I go to hospital I notice there are a lot of people who would like to be able to do more and feel as if they can do nothing at least with a app people can send money to invest in research in areas where they would like to see improvements in research.
attributes.additional_details: I don't feel evidence is something needed in this case. Good people invest in good things and this is one of them.

attributes.action: Address the rise in incidences of dangerous driving on UK roads.
attributes.background: There is a lack of deterrent for dangerous drivers on UK roads. Speeding, illegal manoeuvring and blatant disregard for the Highway Code seem to have become common-place. The UK needs to rethink it's reliance on speed cameras, speed humps, etc. and begin enforcing speed and dangerous driving laws.

attributes.action: Make all drivers carrying passengers for reward take the DVSA Practical & CPC
attributes.background: At present it is optional if licensing authorities make new hackney/ph drivers take a dvsa test. I call for all drivers present and new of any licensing borough to ensure all drivers complete a dvsa practical, hazard perception & cpc. All other professional drivers have to and only equal they do to.
attributes.additional_details: Road safety is becoming harder to tackle across the UK, if we lead the way in Europe on how to maintain road safety by ensuring all drivers who drive for hire & reward take the steps as bus & lorry drivers have then we are one step closer to ensuring safety of passengers in any Taxi/PH vehicle & other road users for social, domestic, pleasure, commercial & business use too. Where the public are concerned this is vital for road safety and passenger reassurance that drivers are trained correctly.

attributes.action: Add safeguards to §111A (Enterprise & Regulatory Reform Act 2013) for employees.
attributes.background:
The current laws regarding 'Settlement Agreements' or 'Without Prejudice Conversations' or 'Protected Conversations' or 'Off the record Conversations' are shockingly lacking in safeguards for the employee.

They can be sprung upon an employee as a way of getting rid of them without red tape.
attributes.additional_details:
They are being used currently by employers as a way to place 'no other options decisions' on the employee and there is not enough safeguarding process to resolve relationship issues through other steps first. Much like you can't go to tribunal without a certificate from ACAS, employers should not be allowed to have these types of conversation without all possible other avenues exhausted first.

I'm not suggesting that the option shouldn't be there, it should just be limited to the final ones.

attributes.action: Automate all trains so there are no longer drivers or manual door openers.
attributes.background: It is ludicrous in 2016 that huge swathes of the country should be held to ransom by union action over something as silly as who controls the doors - personnel are paid far too much to press a button and move a lever. The technology has existed since the 70s to automate all of this.
attributes.additional_details: In 2016 Train Drivers hold the country to ransom whenever they want a pay bump, or even more favourable conditions. The average transport for London driver earns £55k, in the south, the average is £39k. No part of their job requires a human. It's time for progress, guarantee these people jobs until retirement, hire no new drivers - and slowly automate away the skill gap so that the current drivers don't suffer, but that no drivers can come along to make the rest of the country suffer.

attributes.action: Bring university fees down to £4.5 grand a year
attributes.background: People either can't or never pay the money if the government wants their money back they need to bring the fees down

attributes.action: Remove the engine size limit on A1 motorcycle license
attributes.background:
Currently the A1 license has three limitations
* maximum 11 kW
* power-to-weight ratio not more than .1 kW
* must not be more than 125 cc
Whereas the A2 license only has two
Some motorscooters/motorcycles may have over 125cc yet still produce under 11 kW yet adhere to the power limit set by A1
attributes.additional_details:
For example, these currently sold vehicles:

Piaggio Vespa PX150
LML Star 151
LML Star 200 

adhere to the power-to-weight ratio and kW limitations of the A1 license.  Changing the A1 criteria to remove the engine size limit brings it in-line with the A2 license (which is also without engine size limit) and gives a further incentive to pass the A1 test rather than ride on a L-plate under a CBT thus improving road safety

attributes.action: Introduce ‘Digital Judgement’ as a CORE topic in the National Curriculum.
attributes.background: Some outcomes of the internet boom are calls to fight, extremism terrorism and hatred and hoaxes, via new social media propaganda.  These threaten our society and children. It MUST be a priority now to arm our children with 'Digital Judgement'; the skill to cope with the threat of the digital world.
attributes.additional_details: Society is easily seduced by online propaganda, drawn towards anti-social intolerant attitudes and behaviours towards the extremes making governance virtually impossible and increasing risks and costs to individuals and communities.  Being able to recognise and resist internet threats is a crucial skill, but getting increasingly harder. We MUST start NOW educating our children to become ‘critical' users of the social media they will grow up with, and which will shape our society for evermore.

attributes.action: Establish extradition treaties so British victims of crime are supported.
attributes.background: I want to raise the issue of the safety of British Nationals and their families overseas and develop on the international extradition treaties and assistance that is in place.
attributes.additional_details: If you or a member of your family has been subjected to a crime a suspected criminal can flee to another country or back to the UK that has no treaty in place and will not face any criminal proceedings.

attributes.action: Merge health and social care for the elderly and fund from increased income tax.
attributes.background: A single management line for health and social care would increase efficiency and increased taxation is the fairest way to fund proper care.  Seven day medical and social services would enable capital resources to be better utilised.

attributes.action: Negotiate freedom of movement with Canada after Britain leaves the EU.
attributes.background: Both Great Britain and Canada would be greatly benefited by having freedom of movement.

attributes.action: Start a Hate Offender's Register,  modelled on the Sex Offender's Register.
attributes.background: Parents should have the right to know if their child runs the risk of being bullied or radicalised by hate preachers in their neighbourhood. A register of hate offenders will empower subjects of Her Majesty to make informed choices on who they may wish to avoid to keep safe and avoid conflict.

attributes.action: no matter what time in the pregnancy women should be allowed a death certificate
attributes.background: I was 11 weeks pregnant and had a miscarriage it was a horrible experience and not being allowed a death certificate made it a lot harder to cope it makes us feel as though your baby didn't exist when they did a death certificate after a miscarriage any time in the pregnancy should be allowed.
attributes.additional_details: A death certificate is a coping method as well used making it feel like you're baby did exist but not long enough for a birth certificate all couples should be allowed one as a way of coping and feeling like their baby was there.

attributes.action: Force large landowners to increase afforestation to stop flooding downstream
attributes.background: The risk of flooding in lowland areas is currently been increased by large landowners increasing the level of drainage and not increasing the percentage of land covered by woodland. Increases in woodland would both reduce the speed and  water levels reaching watercourses and preventing flooding.
attributes.additional_details: Flooding in low lying areas is caused by four main factors: precipitation levels, level of development on floodplains, speed of water reaching local watercourses and amount reaching watercourses. This petition is trying to encourage legislation in two of these four factors: speed and amount of water reaching local watercourses. Watersheds need vast increases in woodland to slow down water speeds through the leaves of trees, soil saturation and vegetation using water resources.

attributes.action: Make people register for gig tickets before the sale to stop hackers and touts
attributes.background: Its unfair that true fans are missing out on getting tickets to see their favourite artists due to hackers,computer programmes and touts buying tickets in high volumes and re-selling seconds after the tours selling out for extortionate amounts, lets make a registration like glastonbury stand for all

attributes.action: Make Energy Companies pay for the roll out of Smart Meters.
attributes.background: Electricity companies are rolling out Smart Meters at a cost of 11 Billion to their customers. They should be footing the bill from their profits and Government should introduce legislation to protect the rights of consumers.

attributes.action: Make it a criminal offense to vote against, or block the result of a referendum.
attributes.background:
I find it utterly outrageous that there have been politcians in the goverment who have voted against the brexit referendum despite the people winning there right to freedom.

I propose all referendums are legally binding and to hinder,block or frustrate the process will become a criminal act.
attributes.additional_details: Politicians should brace democratic processes.

attributes.action: Make all drinks producers  replace plastic containers with glass bottles.
attributes.background: Many years ago,all drinks were sold in glass bottles with very little effect on the environment,unlike the plastic containers which are causing serious pollution,especially in seas and oceans.
attributes.additional_details: A deposit scheme could be introduced to ensure most bottles were returned for re-cycling.

attributes.action: Lower taxes of pensions for U.K. Armed Forces Officers who served for 20 years
attributes.background: U.K. Armed Forces Officers get paid pensions from the Govenment, however, the government then tax it up to 40%, even though they are risking their lives for the country.

attributes.action: Referendum to accept final Brexit deal and leave EU or reject it and stay in EU.
attributes.background: Many who voted for Brexit did not have a clear idea of what it would mean or did so as a protest vote. This issue is so fundamental to our future that it would be inconceivable and undemocratic not to give everyone a second chance based on all the facts. 16 and 17 year olds should also have a vote.

attributes.action: Add 1p tax on all cartons/bottles/packet sold - money used to clean our streets
attributes.background: Our cities are getting filthier because of the litter, even our countryside is now suffering badly. Councils find it ever harder to deal with this issue with budgetary restraints, particularly in rural areas. Adding 1p to an item will not add much to its cost but could have a very positive effect.
attributes.additional_details: I recently walked two miles of a country lane and collected 28 black bags of plastic and cans! We are sinking in rubbish. A 1p levy on each item (multi packs - 12 pack would pay 12p more) would raise a huge amount of money and could be granted to local councils 'ring fenced' to pay for new employees to clean up the problem.

attributes.action: Declare the Tube an essential service and force unions into compulsory mediation
attributes.background: Tube strikes have been paralyzing London for years for all kinds of reasons. The battle between the unions and TfL management leave the public in the lurch, suffering through queues and bringing roads to a standstill. They do great damage to economy, emergency services and environment.
attributes.additional_details: Compulsory mediation would force both parties to the negotiating table and to achieve a fair outcome through mediation by an independent third party. Strikes are avoided and the public is not harmed by abstract, arcane industrial disputes.

attributes.action: Declare smoking in public areas a criminal offence
attributes.background: Smoking is a choice and no-one should be punished for the choices of another. Smoking should be made illegal in public areas to assist non-smokers who do not wish to be in contact with the toxic fumes of second-hand smoke.
attributes.additional_details: Everyone's needed to walk past someone smoking in public and needing to hold their breath to avoid inhaling the toxic fumes. Every year, second-hand smoke kills thousands of people in the UK from lung cancer, heart disease, strokes and the lung disease COPD. Second-hand smoke has been linked to around 165,000 new cases of disease among children in the UK each year. Passive smoking may also increase the risk of cancers of the larynx and pharynx.

attributes.action: Make it a legal requirement for dog and cat owners to have a licence
attributes.background:
It should be a legal requirement for a potential pet owner to possess a licence to have that animal.

There should be criminal records and background checks completed 
And a crackdown and some sort of policing to stop people from selling pets online

attributes.action: Make it illegal for teachers to stop children going to the toilet at school
attributes.background:
At school children are constantly told they cannot go to the toilet.
Going to the toilet is a basic human right and should not be taken away from you at school.

attributes.action: Install adequately bright street-lighting on all stretches of all UK highways.
attributes.background:
Driving on motorways or on any roads during nighttime can be extremely difficult when the roads are not adequately lit up.
This problem is more severe during the winter period when the nights are longer, darker and prone to complicated weather conditions.
attributes.additional_details:
The amount of drivers using the roads of Great Britain is expanding constantly and the issue of desperately required lighting on all stretches of highways during night hours, which affects millions on a daily, or nightly, basis must be urgently addressed.
This urgent matter affects motorways and all grades of well used roads.

attributes.action: Posthumous pardons for witchcraft, blasphemy & other laws now deemed offensive.
attributes.background: In light of today's posthumous pardons for all gay and bisexual men convicted of decades old sexual offences (convictions which like many others I found deeply upsetting) it is patently unfair that others in history are still regarded as "guilty" of things we would no longer consider as crimes.
attributes.additional_details: As examples: Gwen Ellis sentenced to death for witchcraft in 1594; Helen Duncan, the last person to be convicted (in 1944) of witchcraft under the 1735 act, was imprisoned for nine months; John William Gott imprisoned for blasphemy on December 9, 1921 for nine months with hard labour; The Gay News and Denis Lemon convicted of blasphemous libel in 1977...

attributes.action: Ban vans from the third lane of motorways
attributes.background: I find that as vans have become much more sporty they often use the second overtaking lane of motorways. If you are driving a car or motorcycle in this lane and a van pulls out in front of you, you can't see through or round it.
attributes.additional_details: This is from personal experience and talking to friends and colleagues

attributes.action: People on long term job seekers allowance to do free work for the local councils
attributes.background: I think people that have been on job seekers allowance for more than 3 years. Should have to work for there local councils, picking litter and other jobs such as this, so that the local councils can spend there money more wisely.

attributes.action: Speed up A&E times in UK hospitals
attributes.background: A&E's in the UK have long waiting times to see a nurse or a doctor in the hospital (including emergencies). This has put a lot of pressure on NHS staff which has resulted in longer times to wait.
attributes.additional_details:
- Aim is to speed up the waiting times within UK hospitals.
- Put more NHS nurses and doctors back onto wards.

attributes.action: We should adapt to the same laws Canada has on young relationships
attributes.background: Many teenagers today are tried and parents try to prosecute other kids for simply dating there child even if there 1/2-years younger. We should adapt to the same laws Canada has in this field by making it so you can date anyone within a 3-year age gap if one is over 16 and one is under 16.
attributes.additional_details:
Also don't get me wrong I'm not saying have sex that should remain illegal till there 16, but kissing/cuddling etc is considered sexual contact and I think the law should be changed to prevent innocent people being prosecuted for that.

No 16-year old should be given a trial for dating someone 1-year younger when we have a older generation some with 20-year age gaps and then be quick to judge a small age gap

We need to protect children and focus on what the law was made for. Predatory Old men.

attributes.action: England should be given a referendum on leaving the United Kingdom.
attributes.background: England should be afforded the same democratic rights as Scotland by being offered a referendum on leaving the union.

attributes.action: Urge people to NOT book to go on holiday in the USA until Trump leaves office.
attributes.background: Since Trump wants to exclude certain people based solely on their religion and where they're from, and not because they committed an offence, I think we should show support by choosing not to visit the USA simply to go on holiday. I'd say especially stay away from Trump Hotels.

attributes.action: Make teachers shouting at students a criminal offence
attributes.background: After finding it rather upsetting and difficult after having being shouted at by a teacher and seeing no purpose in this form of abuse , I feel that rules need to be put in place to Stop the Shouting.

attributes.action: Prevent Barack Obama from ever visiting the United Kingdom.
attributes.background:
Barack Obama should not be allowed to enter the UK in any capacity due to the killing of innocent Muslims by the US army whilst he was head of the US government. 

https://www.theguardian.com/world/2015/dec/12/msf-afghanistan-hospital-airstrike-death-toll-42

attributes.action: Make all Utility Companies publicly owned & Running Costs paid by the Tax Payer
attributes.background: I want the government to make all Utility Companies publicly owned as Non Profit Companies & cover all Running Costs by the Tax Payer. This will ensure the disabled, elderly & people out of work can heat their houses & not have to worry about bailiffs coming to their door for non payment of bills.
attributes.additional_details: Losing your job, being elderly or disabled is financially hard enough. Many have to deal with unscrupulous bailiffs for non payment of utility bills, leaving some feeling suicidal. These vulnerable people should not be asked to pay for utility bills that they cannot afford. However, this also means that the government can pay them less benefits as their utility bills are already covered. Plus if utility companies are non profit and publicly owned, everyone's bills will be cheaper to begin with.

attributes.action: Have all secondary schools in the UK teach students mental health.
attributes.background: I feel this is import as students should know about mental health issues and the symptoms that come with it. This gives students more of an understanding of mental health and shows that it is not something they should be afraid of.
attributes.additional_details:
"Growing number of children self-harming as mental health problems amongst pupils rise, says new survey"- http://www.independent.co.uk/news/education/education-news/growing-number-of-children-self-harming-as-mental-health-problems-amongst-pupils-rise-says-new-a6912906.html

Students need to know they shouldn't be ashamed of having a mental health condition and how to deal with having a condition in the right way.

attributes.action: Theory test for car license has to be in all languages.
attributes.background: Allow people from different countries to get the license in their own language.

attributes.action: More Financial transparency for care leavers going into higher education.
attributes.background: Care leavers that come from disadvantaged backgrounds should be given total transparency over what actual support is available to them when accessing higher education. More fincial support should be offered as student loans at 7k per year is not enough specially when not at uni in the summer time.

attributes.action: Make it law for any petition with 300k+ signatures to actually be debated
attributes.background: It is disingenuous of the government to state they will only consider debating a petition if it reaches 100k. I propose that if a petition reaches 300k it must be debated whether or not the subject has been debated on a previous occasion. We must have a mechanism that ensure debates are held.

attributes.action: Put a public multi-section recycling bin on over 50% of Britain's roads
attributes.background: Roads like mine don't have enough regular bins. The country simply needs more if you expect people not to litter or have recyclable items end up in landfill. Give us lot a chance to have nicer places to live. Give us somewhere to put our rubbish and recyclable items when we're out and about.
attributes.additional_details: There are about 250,000 roads or ways in the UK, so it would be too costly to cover them but we need to start somewhere.

attributes.action: Enshrine into law 1% of GDP  to be spent in NHS funding
attributes.background: The NHS needs guaranteed spending to allow the provision of free treatment for all UK citizens to continue. In the light of the government enshrining 0.6% of GDP spending, into law, to fund Foreign Aid we call upon the government to enshrine spending of 1% of GDP, into law, to fund the NHS.

attributes.action: The National Insurance Tax to fund the NHS; Social Care & Pensions.
attributes.background:
This would ensure everyone will have contributed to their state benefits. There are more people than homes.
Funding from the councils is selective and is a second time tax by the government imposed on the few.

attributes.action: Make training courses VAT exempt to encourage young people to learn new skills
attributes.background: I believe that training course should be VAT exempt as it helps young people learn new skills. VAT can be extremely expensive on week long course and puts may off taking them. By removing VAT from these courses it would encourage employers to invest in training to develop their employees.

attributes.action: Change the way that benefits are calculated to take cost of living into account
attributes.background: Benefit claimants living in an area where the cost of living is particularly high are at a disadvantage. Local Housing Allowance takes property prices in the applicant's area into consideration when calculating Housing Benefit entitlement, and I believe benefit rates should be calculated similarly

attributes.action: Call a general election in two years when the terms for Brexit are known.
attributes.background:
Whilst Parliament will be given an opportunity to comment on terms of Brexit, the UK public will not be able to vote on the biggest political decision in decades.

There is no democracy in this as the terms of Brexit were not clear when the referendum vote took place.

attributes.action: A public consultation with the people on the terms of leaving the EU.
attributes.background:
Since Britain voted to leave the EU we have heard from politicians, the media, and industry on their wants from future negotiations. 

A responsible Government should immediately begin a public consultation with the people to ensure their views are heard as part of any future negotiations.
attributes.additional_details:
The British People took power on whether we wanted to leave the EU in the June 2016 referendum, we have now become the silent voice in the debate over the terms of our departure. 

This petition is about ensuring that after having made the decision, the British people continue to be consulted on the type of future they want for their country.
